intro: Wissadula oligomera, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas. It has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Wissadula oligomera is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a hardy species in harsh environments.
